recommendations.recommendation: Mixed bag of genres that came out good
An all time classic. One of the best Animes ever made. Great fantasy with fantastic animations.
This is one of the anime`s that really opened my eyes for the anime world.
A classic and amazing series that`s as much old school as it is timeless. A must see for any anime fan.
Very good series with a good storyline, good characters (strange noses though), good music ... everything is right about this series.
I think this is the most philosofic anime i have ever watched. Great characters, great story.

I can very well claim that this is unique in its genre. Medieval style mecha without the high tech mumbo jumbo easily encountered in other "attempts" of the sort. In my long years watching anime I have this one as my personal favourite and one of the best I ever saw along with its movie.
A Wonderfull and Awesome Anime it was my First Anime and it was very good^^
Most definitely an all-time favorite! It may have mecha in it, but that isn`t what Escaflowne is all about! There is a little of everything for everyone!

Great blend of Shoujo and Mecha.
Though IMO has the worst last ep. It`s like they found out they didn`t actually have 2 more eps with 5 min left of animation in ep26.
Interesting combination of mechs in a fantasy world. Nice characters and mecha design, good animation. Addictive watch because of good pacing.

My first anime, and one of the better mecha series. Great actions scenes, amazing characters, and a story that reveals itself at the perfect pace. Swords, angels, kings, dragons and love, look no further.

This series is in my top 10 list. It has everything a good anime needs, and it does all of it nearly perfectly. I know this series is called shoujo, but its really hard to tell. This is one of those classics that everyone should watch just so they know what a good anime is. Its a bit older, but then so are alot of the best series out there. Watch it, I`m sure you`ll love it.

This one is from a time when anime studios were not yet afraid to put time, money and effort into the making of series. I always liked this one since the first time I watched it. Although having some shoujo anime elements to it, the action and great soundtrack can definitely make up for this.

It`s like Skyrim, for girls and with mechas. It`s like Gundam, but better written. It`s like if Macross and 12 Kingdoms had sex and this was their daughter. it`s like Game of Thrones, without tits, gore and sex.
Mix of mecha + fantasy + romance = great show. :D
Classic. Epic. Must See. Enough said.
A wonderful blend of every genre there is. Masterful!
Escaflowne is a classic that I consistently rewatch.This show has everything - dragons, mechs, fighting, flying, catgirls, magic, big noses, etc.
quite easily one of the best anime series ever created.
Classic with mecha, fantasy and romance.

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch9558 [Kanzaki Hitomi] is a typical high school girl, with the usual problems, but when a vision of a young man battling a dragon becomes a reality, her life changes dramatically. Drawn into a strange vortex with the swordsman, http://anidb.net/ch12369 [Van], Hitomi is thrust into the mysterious world of Gaea. Van must learn to master the suit of armour, Escaflowne, before he and Hitomi are crushed by the ambitions of the Empire of Zaibach. Van and Hitomi will encounter both allies and enemies in an effort to unlock the secrets of Escaflowne, and Hitomi`s heart, stirred by love and adventure, will, at times ache with sorrow. But why was she sent to this world? Her journey has just begun!

tag.name: juujin
tag.description: Kemono, "beast", is a genre of Japanese art and character design that prominently features anthropomorphic animal characters. It is used widely in visual arts, especially drawing and painting, and can be found in many manga, anime, and video game. Anthropomorphic animal characters in the kemono genre are frequently called juujin, "therianthrope"; the kanji for juujin are also sometimes pronounced kemonobito, "beast-human". While their design differs from artist to artist, they generally employ animal traits considered cute and endearing; most kemono characters retain a fundamentally human personality, however, seldom behaving as the actual animals from which they have been anthropomorphized, and as such they are typically depicted living as humans do. Juujin leans more on the human-looking side when compared to http://anidb.net/t2857 [anthropomorphism], which leans more on the animal-looking side. Source: Manga Wikia

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: angel
tag.description: An angel is a supernatural being, said to be the messenger of God. They are often depicted as human beings with a pair of white feathered wings and sometimes with a halo. In contrast, a fallen angel who has turned evil will be depicted with black wings.

tag.name: dragon
tag.description: Very intelligent mythical beings - a cross between a very large lizard and a dinosaur - that breath fire, and have a knack for kidnapping damsels, thus distressing them. In Fantasy anime this perceptive species often lives secluded from human civilisation, protectors of long lost knowledge. Dragons seem to be on the verge of extinction.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: alternative present
tag.description: Anime that fit in the alternative present category usually have technology and society that is very similar to ours, but with differences in both, history and culture, which sometimes are blatantly obvious, but sometimes harder to place; this one can at times be very subjective.

tag.name: transforming craft
tag.description: A transforming craft is an object built by humans or other intelligent lifeforms, usually a robot but sometimes also a vehicle of some sort, that can rearrange its parts in order to switch between a minimum of two forms.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: love polygon
tag.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: parallel world
tag.description: A parallel world, parallel universe, or alternative reality is a self-contained separate reality coexisting with our own. Because "alternative reality" sometimes implies that the reality is a variant of our own, like for example a mirror world, we use the term "parallel world/universe" which is more general, without any connotations implying a relationship (or lack thereof) with our own world/universe (meaning a fictional world can just as well have an alternative reality, it doesn`t need to be our reality). To put it more simply, this category is to show if more than 1 world/universe/reality is present in the anime. Multiple timelines of the same world/universe/reality are NOT considered parallel worlds. For example, in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate] the cast travels through multiple "World Lines", which are defined as parallel timelines of the same universe had various events occurred with differing outcomes.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: steampunk
tag.description: Steampunk is a sub-genre of science fiction that typically features steam-powered machinery, especially in a setting inspired by industrialized Western civilization during the 19th century. Steampunk works are often set in an alternative history of the 19th century`s British Victorian era or American "Wild West", in a post-apocalyptic future during which steam power has regained mainstream use, or in a fantasy world that similarly employs steam power. Noteworthy attributes of the theme include large amounts smoke pollution from wood or coal burning, the affinity to metal constructs like cogs and metal tubing, and the mechanization of everyday objects. Steampunk perhaps most recognisably features anachronistic technologies or retro-futuristic inventions as people in the 19th century might have envisioned them, and is likewise rooted in the era`s perspective on fashion, culture, architectural style, and art. Such technology may include fictional machines like those found in the works of H. G. Wells and Jules Verne, or the modern authors Philip Pullman, Scott Westerfeld, Stephen Hunt and China Miéville. Other examples of steampunk contain alternative history-style presentations of such technology as lighter-than-air airships, analog computers, or such digital mechanical computers as Charles Babbage`s Analytical Engine. Steampunk can also exemplify everything that is bad about unrestrained technological progress (dead matter), when compared to life and nature. The anime usually makes a point to propound the latter. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: damsel in distress
tag.description: The damsel in distress is usually a young, nubile woman placed in a dire predicament by a villain or a monster and requires a hero to dash to her rescue. Often used to unite the cast of a show for this one goal, to make them put differences aside and become a band of nakama. Examples: Sakoshita Yanagi from Rekka no Honoo, Yuuki Miaka from Fushigi Yuugi or Higurashi Kagome from Inuyasha.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: wardrobe limited to school uniform
tag.description: The main characters only wear school uniforms, even though other clothes would be more appropriate. Example: Kagome in Inu Yasha, wears her uniform in Inu Yasha`s world, although she is shown to own other clothes at home.

tag.name: sociocultural evolution
tag.description: Describes how cultures and societies develop over time, based on both cultural evolution and social evolution. A post-apocalyptic or a Utopian setting would show very interesting changes in human behaviour, mental state, or simply daily life.

tag.name: optic camouflage
tag.description: Optic camouflage is a type of camouflage that distinguishes itself for actively altering optical properties around itself in order to make the wearer invisible. This could be said to be a high-tech form of "invisibility cloak".

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: inter-dimensional schoolgirl
tag.description: One, or more, schoolgirls cross through time, space or some dimension using a space-warp-magic-portal-wormhole-singularity-thing to save one, or more, worlds, or planets. A major twist could be that the schoolgirl might originate from that very magic-futuristic world, bearing one great secret legendary power to defeat one big bad legendary foe. The return back home is the leitmotiv of the whole series.

tag.name: lost technology
tag.description: Any advanced technology or science-related knowledge that was lost for some reason fits the description. This could be technology from a time before a post-apocalyptic cataclysm, knowledge gained a long time ago but forgotten, or the relics of an old alien civilization only recently discovered.

tag.name: fast-paced
tag.description: Hold onto your hats, this anime`s storyline is relentless. The characters don`t get time to take a breath as events keep both them and the viewer on a roller coaster ride of revelation and excitement! Hopefully it all makes sense...

tag.name: tarot
tag.description: The tarot is a pack of playing cards, most commonly numbering 78, used from the mid-15th century in various parts of Europe to play a group of card games such as Italian tarocchini and French tarot. From the late 18th century until the present time, the tarot has also found use by mystics and occultists for divination. Tarot cards are used throughout much of Europe to play card games. In English-speaking countries, where these games are largely unplayed, tarot cards are now used primarily for divinatory purposes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: medieval
tag.description: Setting is placed in the so called "dark ages". It can be either European style, oriental style or Chinese/Japanese style of castles, armour, ways of fighting etc.. Also the average education is weak, superstition is high and fights are settled on foot or horseback. Furthermore the level to technology is rather low. Note: The perceived low level of cultural and technological evolution may be offset by an influx of magic (fantasy stories) or very sophisticated technology that the inhabitants choose to make less obvious to the viewer.

tag.name: gender bender
tag.description: Term used to refer to a person who takes on the role of their opposite gender. This often only reaches to the extent of cross-dressing (involving physical appearance and clothing only), but in rarer cases, involves a total gender swap (which seems to be more common in anime) - where the willing or unwilling victim receives a body opposite of their original gender (either permanently or temporarily), with all natural parts per their new body fully (or just all-out amply) included. Example of cross-dressing gender bender: "Maria+Holic" Examples of body-swap gender bender: "Kashimashi: Girl meets Girl", "Birdy the Mighty Decode"

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: isekai
tag.description:
An isekai story is one in which the lead characters are transferred to and become stuck or trapped in another world, one completely different from the one they lived in up until the transfer. The new world is commonly a http://anidb.net/t2628 [fictional world], such as a http://anidb.net/t2838 [parallel world] or http://anidb.net/t2839 [virtual world] (other fictional world types can also apply). What defines the isekai genre is that the characters are sent to another world, often but not always a parallel one, and they generally cannot come back permanently without meeting a highly specific goal. In order to adapt to their new environment, they must use the abilities and knowledge brought from their former world as well as any that may have been bestowed upon them by their brave new world. In some cases, they will seek and eventually find a way to return; in others, they will gleefully embrace their new life. http://anidb.net/a144 [Inuyasha] is an example where isekai applies to a fictional world that is not also a parallel or virtual world. http://anidb.net/ch7246 [Higurashi Kagome] climbs down an ancient well at her grandfather`s shrine and is transported to feudal Japan (time travel). While she eventually gains the physical ability to travel back and forth between her time period and feudal Japan, her bonds and responsibilities to feudal Japan tie her there until they are ultimately resolved. For clarity, below is an illustrative example where isekai is applied to a non-fictional, non-parallel, non-virtual world.
* The main characters are from Earth. One day, they are abducted by Nazis from Mars (alternate "world") are brought back to their Martian base. The main characters are trapped on Mars. Their only escape is to defeat the Nazis and steal their spaceship to return to Earth (specific goal required to escape); they are left to thier own devices, with no prospect of help from Earth, and no way to contact Earth.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Van Fanel
character.description: Van Fanel is the second protagonist of the series, the young king of Fanelia, the second son of King Goau and Queen Varie. Varie was a Draconian, winged people descended from the people of Atlantis. The Draconians were stigmatized and believed to be bearers of bad luck. At a young age Van was cautioned against carelessly showing his wings, a mark of his Draconian heritage. When Van was 5 years old, his father died of unknown causes. His older brother, Folken, was given the test of kingship but never returned and Van believed he was killed, though others accused Folken of fleeing. Van`s mother grew ill from heartache and eventually died. Balgus, a trusted knight of his father`s, returned after a long absence and became Van`s surrogate father. When Van was fifteen, he performed the rite of dragonslaying to assume his throne. During the battle with the dragon, both he and the dragon were mysteriously transported to Earth, where he encounters a young high school girl named Hitomi and her friends. He works to protect them from the dragon, only to have Hitomi save his live when she foresees one of the dragon`s moves. After the dragon is killed, Van is transported back to Gaea, along with Hitomi. During his coronation as King, the Zaibach Empire attacked Fanelia. Van activates the kingdom`s greatest treasure, a Guymelef named Escaflowne. To activate the system, Van forms a blood pact with it, tying his own life to Escaflowne when he is piloting it. Though Van wants to protect his kingdom with the powerful machine, he is forced to flee his kingdom with Hitomi, only to learn later that Fanelia was burned to the ground by Zaibach. During the beginning of the series Van was frequently told that his attacks weren`t "aggressive" enough, Van`s reasoning being that he didn`t like bloodshed or the thought of killing someone. After he stated this, he was told that as a king of Fanelia this was not an appropriate point of view and that he would have to fight regardless of his feelings. However, as the series progresses and Van`s misfortune only increases, he becomes bent on revenge and begins to enjoy battle to the point of engaging in a seemingly "fight to the death" match with his comrade Allen. Yet, his love for Hitomi proves stronger than his love for battle and he eventually removes Escaflowne`s energist stating that he would like to see a future where Escaflowne isn`t needed.

character.name: Merle
character.description: Merle is a 13-year-old cat-girl and childhood friend of Van. She is jealous of Van`s increasingly close relationship with Hitomi, but eventually comes to accept Hitomi; and becomes a loyal friend to her. As Van becomes conflicted in his relationship with Hitomi, Merle reveals to him that he loves Hitomi and that Merle had recognized it long before he did. She encourages Van to go find Hitomi after Hitomi unexpectedly returns to the Mystic Moon and assures Van that his feelings will reach Hitomi. An orphan, she has since devotedly followed Van since she was picked up by the Fanelian courts. She never hesitates to protect Van at all costs (the twins Eriya and Nariya spared Van`s life once when Merle hauled herself in front of him, seeing their past selves reflected on her).

character.name: Allen Crusader Schezar
character.description: Allen Schezar is a member of the Knight Caeli, Asturia`s elite knights who bears an uncanny resemblance to Hitomi`s high school crush, Susumu Amano. When Allen was younger, his younger sister Celena was kidnapped by Zaibach, his father disappeared mysteriously, and his mother died shortly afterwards. He has captured the heart of Princess Millerna of Asturia, but also demonstrates strong feelings for Hitomi as the series progresses. He was a gifted swordsman at a young age, becoming one of the most skilled fighters of Gaea under the expert tutelage of Balgus of Fanelia. During his early knight career he and Princess Marlene fell in love and she bore his child, Chid. Later within the series, Allen briefly becomes romantically involved with Hitomi through Dornkirk`s influence. Allen also harbors a great deal of anger towards his father, Leon, for leaving his mother and family behind (it is later revealed that Leon truly loved Allen`s mother and was murdered by Dornkirk`s soldiers for the secrets of Atlantis.)

character.name: Folken Lacour de Fanel
character.description: Folken Lacour de Fanel the Strategos or tactician of Zaibach, Folken is revealed to be Van`s older brother and the original heir to Fanelia. After he failed to kill a dragon, he lost an arm to the beast and was later picked up by the Zaibach, who nursed him back to health under Dornkirk`s instructions and fitted him with a mechanical arm. He originally joined the empire in hopes of realizing Zaibach`s ideals of a world free of war, but is later disillusioned and defects. He, like Van, is half Draconian and thus he also has angelic wings. But, His wings have turned black. Source: wiki

character.name: Gades
character.description: Gades is the jaunty second-in-command at http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s fort positioned on the Fanelian/Astorian border. Gades handles the seemingly impossible task of overseeing the crew of the Crusade airship. Stalwart and easy going, he can still be relied upon whenever Allen & company get into trouble. Source: Escaflowne Wiki

character.name: Plaktu
character.description: Plaktu is the official hypnotizer of the Duchy of Fried who serves the royal family.

character.name: Zongi
character.description: Zongi is a Doppelganger who has the ability to become invisible and take on other people`s appearances. He is a skilled spy and assassin who serves under http://anidb.net/ch38070 [Lord Folken].

character.name: Sid-ouji
character.description: Prince Sid is the heir to the Duchy of Freid.

character.name: Boris
character.description: Boris handles the public affairs of Freid, which include commanding the military during war. Of all his duties, he regards the safeguarding of the royalty as the most important.

character.name: Mahad dal Freid
character.description: Mahad dal Freid is the ruler of the Duchy of Freid.

character.name: Marlene
character.description: Marlene was the eldest Princess of Astoria and Duchess of Freid.

character.name: Elise
character.description: Elise is the second Princess of Astoria who appears to fulfill a more advisory, political role than her other sisters. In addition, Elise does not allow an arranged marriage for herself, unlike her sisters.

character.name: Miguel Lavariel
character.description: Miguel Lavariel is a member of Zaibach`s Dragon Slayers.

character.name: Varie Fanel
character.description: Varie Fanel is a Draconian woman who married http://anidb.net/ch84885 [Goou Fanel] and gave birth to http://anidb.net/ch38070 [Folken Fanel] and http://anidb.net/ch12369 [Van Fanel].

character.name: Goou Fanel
character.description: Goou Fanel was the king of Fanelia before http://anidb.net/ch12369 [Van]. He was the husband of http://anidb.net/ch84884 [Varie Fanel] and father of http://anidb.net/ch38070 [Folken Fanel] and Van Fanel.

character.name: Meiden Fassa
character.description: Meiden Fassa is one of the most prestigious magnates in the merchantile country of Astoria who takes full advantage of his influence and close ties to http://anidb.net/ch84887 [King Aston]. He sits in Astoria`s High Council, and managed to arrange his http://anidb.net/ch39064 [son]`s betrothal to http://anidb.net/ch39058 [Princess Mirana].

character.name: Aston-ou
character.description: King Aston is the ruler of the rich merchant kingdom of Astoria. Also, he is a father of http://anidb.net/ch39058 [Mirana], http://anidb.net/ch84873 [Elise] and http://anidb.net/ch84870 [Marlene].

character.name: Leon Schezar
character.description: Leon Schezar is the father of http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen] and http://anidb.net/ch38104 [Celena Schezar]. Allen holds a grudge against his father because he left their family to search for the secrets of Atlantis.

character.name: Hitomi no Sobo
character.description: Hitomi`s grandmother was transported to Gaia in a mysterious pillar of light. After she ended up on Gaia, she met http://anidb.net/ch84888 [Leon Schezar] who was travelling on his quest to uncover the mystery of Atlantis.

character.name: Hitomi no Haha
character.description: Hitomi`s mother appears in episode 16 where she tells http://anidb.net/ch38103 [Amano Susumu] and http://anidb.net/ch38102 [Uchida Yukari] the story about http://anidb.net/ch84904 [Hitomi`s grandmother].

character.name: Bantou
character.description: A clerk who works for http://anidb.net/ch39064 [Dryden]. He is constantly worried about Dryden`s huge expenses. Note: the word "bantou" means "clerk" in Japanese.

character.name: Gishichou
character.description: The chief engineer of Ispano - a mysterious clan that used to serve the Atlanteans and build guymelefs. The Ispano still maintain guymelefs; however, they charge exorbitant fees for their services. Note: "gishichou" means "chief engineer" in Japanese.

character.name: Shesta
character.description: Shesta is a member of Zaibach`s Dragon Slayers.

character.name: Orto
character.description: Orto is one of the soldiers under http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s command. He specializes in throwing knives.

character.name: Kio
character.description: Kio is one of the soldiers under http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s command. He steers the Crusade airship and always wears armour.

character.name: Reeden
character.description: Reeden is one of the soldiers under http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s command. He always wears a red bandana.

character.name: Kaja
character.description: Kaja is the leader of Zegu clan that protects the secret treasure of Freid.

character.name: Teo
character.description: Teo is one of the soldiers under http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s command.

character.name: Katz
character.description: Katz is one of the soldiers under http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s command.

character.name: Byle
character.description: Byle is one of the soldiers under http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen]`s command.

character.name: Dallet
character.description: Dallet is a member of Zaibach`s Dragon Slayers.

character.name: Enshia Schezar
character.description: Enshia Schezar was the wife of http://anidb.net/ch84888 [Leon Schezar] and the mother of http://anidb.net/ch38069 [Allen] and http://anidb.net/ch38104 [Celena Schezar].

character.name: Gatti
character.description: Gatti is a member of Zaibach`s Dragon Slayers.

episode.title: 恋の黄金律作戦
Operation Golden Rule of Love
Die Kraft der Liebe
La stratégie de la règle d`or de l`amour
Koi no Ougonritsu Sakusen
episode.summary: Everyone reunites in Asturia. Dryden announces that he and Millerna will marry. Van asks Hitomi to stay with him, but fails to portray his feelings correctly. Folken plans to use the ‘fate alter’ to change Hitomi and Van’s destiny forever. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の引力
The Gravity of Destiny
Die Macht des Schicksals
La puissance du destin
Unmei no Inryoku
episode.summary: Hitomi, Van, and Allen come face to face with the one behind Zaibach—Dornkirk. He tells them how he came to Gaea and the reason behind his grand plot. When they are imprisoned, Van must use his connection to Escaflowne to rescue them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: この世の果て
The Edge of the World
Das Ende der Welt
Jusqu`au bout du monde
Kono Yo no Hate
episode.summary: Hitomi opens the way to the Mystic Valley, and when they arrive, Van and Allen are transported to different planes. As Hitomi and the others find out more about Atlantis, Hitomi is told the dark truth about her powers and predictions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 導かれし者
The Guided Ones
Das Tal der Wunder
Les guides
Michibikareshi Mono
episode.summary: Much to Allen’s displeasure, Dryden takes his father’s diary and tries to find clues to the Mystic Valley. There they can learn more about Atlantis and the Draconians. But the girl Allen’s father speaks of…does she have a tie to Hitomi? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 失われた楽園
Lost Paradise
Das verlorene Paradies
Paradis perdu
Ushinawareta Rakuen
episode.summary: Van is overcome by the souls of Dilandau’s men that he has killed, and he loses himself inside Escaflowne. Hitomi goes in after him, hoping to reach him. And while Van recovers from the incident, two women from Zaibach attack them in the night. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 危険な傷跡
Dangerous Wounds
Die Menschmaschine
La cicatrice du danger
Kiken na Kizuato
episode.summary: Van is gravely injured after the battle. They bring him to the ship of Dryden, Millerna’s fiancé. He tells them that Guymelefs like Escaflowne are cursed. To heal Van, they need to fix Escaflowne. But, unfortunately, it’s not that simple. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 羽根の記憶
Memories of a Feather
Die Schwingen der Erinnerung
Les ailes de la mémoire
Hane no Kioku
episode.summary: Allen and his men make their way to Freid, hoping to find Van and Hitomi. Meanwhile, Hitomi learns more about Van’s past and his wings. As they make their way to Freid, they encounter Zaibach and their invisible Guymelefs. Will they finally get Escaflowne? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 赤い運命
Red Destiny
Der Tempel der Fortuna
Le fil rouge du destin
Akai Unmei
episode.summary: After fleeing the burning city of Freid, Van and the others follow the Duke to learn about the secret power of Freid and the history of Atlantis. As they prep to face Zaibach, Hitomi has a bloody vision about the Duke’s fate. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天使の舞う日
The Day the Angel Flew
Der Tag des Engels
Le jour de la danse de l`ange
Tenshi no Mau Hi
episode.summary: Van, Hitomi, and Merle escape into the forest while Allen is imprisoned by the King of Palas. Dilandau’s forces leave the city and head towards the Duchy of Freid. After resting, Van and the others take Escaflowne towards a dragon graveyard. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘密の扉
The Secret Door
Das verborgene Geheimnis
La porte aux secrets
Himitsu no Tobira
episode.summary: Duke Freid arrives and asks Allen to join his army. Hitomi struggles with the death of Zongi which keeps replaying in her mind. She refuses to use her powers out of fear, but, when she does a reading for Chid, she learns a great secret. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 予期せぬ別れ
Unexpected Partings
Der Aufbruch ins Ungewisse
Séparation imprévue
Yokisenu Wakare
episode.summary: Van successfully passes the King’s test with Escaflowne. But as they rest, more danger is just around the corner. And when Hitomi gets kidnapped, the rescue mission gives Dilandau the perfect opportunity to go after Escaflowne. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死の予言
Prophecy of Death
Die tödliche Vision
Prédiction mortelle
Shi no Yogen
episode.summary: Hitomi is questioned by the Plaktu imposter, Zongi. When he touches her pendant, she sees his true form and a vision of his death. When the vision ends, Zongi runs off, and Hitomi’s heart stops. Can Van get to Zongi before everything is revealed to Dilandau? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 策謀の都
City of Intrigue
Die Stadt der Intrigen
La cité des intrigues
Sakubou no Miyako
episode.summary: With Van rescued, they make their way to the capital, Palas. Allen seeks audience with the King of Palas but finds Zaibach soldiers already there. Van chases after his brother for answers on his disappearance and why he has joined Zaibach. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青き瞳の王子
The Blue-Eyed Prince
Der Prinz mit den blauen Augen
Le prince aux yeux bleus
Aoki Hitomi no Ouji
episode.summary: Millerna is able to save Allen, and they continue their passage to Freid. When they arrive, they warn Prince Chid about Zaibach’s intentions. But when a doppelganger sent by Folken tricks the prince, Allen is arrested as a traitor to Freid and Asturia. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 永遠の想い
Eternal Love
Ewige Liebe
Un souvenir éternel
Eien no Omoi
episode.summary: Zaibach is defeated, but the fighting doesn’t end. Allen stops Van from killing Dilandau and the two face off. Hitomi reaches out to Van to stop his drive to fight. When they finally realize their feelings, can the hatred and war finally end? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 兄弟の刻印
The Seal of the Brothers
Die Bruderfehde
Le sceau de la fraternité
Kyoudai no Kokuin
episode.summary: Van attempts to lead Dilandau away with Escaflowne, but when they finally face each other, Van is no match and is captured. While Hitomi and Allen attempt to find him, Van has an unexpected reunion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絶対幸運圏
Zone of Absolute Fortune
Die Sphäre des vollkommenen Glücks
La sphère du bonheur absolu
Zettai Kouunken
episode.summary: Hitomi and Van return to Gaea on a bloodied battlefield. Van agrees to stay and fight but sends Hitomi to Asturia. Worried, she asks for Folken’s help but he plans to go instead. But the vision she has of his fate…can she really let him face Dornkirk? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔性の美少年
The Diabolical Adonis
Das Gesicht des Bösen
Un garçon diabolique
Mashou no Bishounen
episode.summary: Hitomi warns Allen and his men about the danger she saw in her vision. But even with the warning, will Allen’s army have the means to defend their castle from Zaibach? Or will the people of Asturia lose their home just like Fanelia? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の選択
Fateful Decision
Die schicksalhafte Entscheidung
Le choix d`un destin
Unmei no Sentaku
episode.summary: Hitomi wakes up back in her world. Even though she is home, she feels a pull towards Gaea and towards Van. Back in Asturia, Allen is shocked when his lost sister, Celena, suddenly returns. But the reunion might not be what he expects. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 華麗なる剣士
The Gallant Swordsman
Der edle Ritter
Le guerrier magnifique
Kareinaru Kenshi
episode.summary: Hitomi is separated from Van, and when she is attacked, her savior is a handsome knight named Allen Schezar who bears a similar appearance to Amano. When she reunites with Van, more trouble awaits them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嵐の予感
Storm Premonition
Die Ruhe vor dem Sturm
Prélude à la tempête
Arashi no Yokan
episode.summary: Folken goes to Asturia seeking Asylum. As an offering, he reveals everything about Zaibach including what they plan on doing next. The kingdom prepares for war, and Allen asks Hitomi to marry him. Before she can finally answer him, Zaibach attacks. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻の月の少女
The Girl from the Mystic Moon
Das Mädchen vom Mond der Illusionen
La fille de la lune des illusions
Maboroshi no Tsuki no Shoujo
episode.summary: Werewolves, cat girls, and dragons. It’s a bit much for Hitomi to take in as she finds herself on the planet known as Gaea. Before she can get comfortable, invisible enemies attack the kingdom, and she must entrust her life to King Van and Escaflowne. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒き翼の天使
The Black-Winged Angel
Der Engel mit den schwarzen Flügeln
L`ange aux ailes ténébreuses
Kuroki Tsubasa no Tenshi
episode.summary: Hitomi and Van go to meet with Folken in the ruins of Fanelia. Folken tells him about the day he abandoned his home and how he came to work under Dornkirk. He reveals his true motives and wishes. But is it what Van also wants? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の告白
Fateful Confession
Der Lauf des Schicksals
La promesse du destin
Unmei no Kokuhaku
episode.summary: Hitomi lives a relatively normal life. She runs on the track team, enjoys fortune telling, and has a major crush on Amano from the boys’ track team. But everything changes when a strange boy appears from another realm along with…a dragon?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幸運の反作用
Reaction of Fortune
Die Kriegerinnen des Glücks
Les revers du destin
Kouun no Hansayou
episode.summary: Naria captures Hitomi but struggles as she reacts poorly to the Luck Intensifier. Van searches for her on Escaflowne and faces Eriya. Unable to take on the luck soldier, he focuses his efforts on attacking Folken. Will this finally be the end? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偽りの契り
False Vows
Das Gefährliche Spiel
Le serment du mensonge
Itsuwari no Chigiri
episode.summary: Folken infuses Naria and Eriya with Fortune Blood to increase their luck. With this, they should be able to finally take on Van. On the day of the wedding, Hitomi reads Millerna’s fortune. But when she wills the cards to change, destiny changes forever. Source: crunchyroll
